summary: Fügt neue Rüstungen in die Level Liste ein. Es handelt sich dabei in der Regel um leichtere/freizügigere Versionen der normalen Banditen/Lederrüstungen, das sorgt für mehr Vielfalt.
descriptionHtml:
!!!!!!!!!!!!!! THIS IS ONLY THE GERMAN TRANSLATION OF THIS MOD  !!!!!!!!!!!



Dies ist nur eine kleine Übersetzung der Mod von rahman530 ins Deutsche.
Die Mod wird ständig erweitert und fügt neue Rüstungen in die Level Liste ein. Es handelt sich dabei in der Regel um leichtere/freizügigere Versionen der normalen Banditen/Lederrüstungen, das sorgt für mehr Vielfalt. 

!!!! leider gehen beim update auf die 1.7.2 schon erworbene Rüstungen verloren !!!!

Bitte beachtet die readme, bestimmte Rüstungen können nur in der Himmelsschmiede geschmiedet werden, andere verlangen eine bestimmte Qualifikation der Schmiedekunst!

credits:
thanks to rahman530 for the permission to translate this mod and for his great work.

norden

Das Original findet ihr hier: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6684

Weitere Übersetzungen von mir:
[url=http://forum.scharesoft.de/showthread.php?42817-Eure-selbsterstellten-Skyrim-Mods&p=909195&viewfull=1#post909195]Scharesoft.de[/url]


Original Readme:

This was originally just an armor compilation of all my previous armor replacers into standalones but since then, has grown and will continue growing.
This mod adds to the game, new sets of armor which you can craft or occationally run into NPCs wearing them. All armors are upgradable and require perks to be able to craft.

Currently only includes 7 armor sets (will be adding more, you can also PM me your ideas)

Thanks to Lateraliss for his/her wonderful guide on adding new armors to skyrim.

(PLEASE READ BELLOW ON WHAT PERK REQUIREMENT YOU NEED FOR CERTAIN ARMORS)
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
CHANGELOG

v1.7.2
- Remade a fresh new esp for better compatibility with other mods(sorry but if you have any previous versions,your armors will disapear, again. :( you will need to reforge your armors)
- Fix heroic imperial armor causing arm to be invisible
- Changes perk requirements and material requirements of armors (read below)
- rebalanced armor rating and weight of some armors

v1.7.1
- Fixed some minor bugs
- Fixed hair clipping through hood
- Increased armor rating of ranger armor
- Heroic Imperial Armor now requires Dwarven Smithing perk

v1.7
- Added new armor (Heroic Imperial Armor)
- Added new armor (Mercanary Armor)
- Balanced out crafting of some armor parts
- Fix some clipping issues and bugs
- Added some changes to the barbarian armor

v1.6
- Armors are now in leveled item list.

v1.5c
- fixed amulet bug with barbarian armor
- added perk requirements for most armors. See Below
- fix upgrading issues with dwarven mage armor

v1.5b
- Added new armor, Dwarven Mage Armor
- fixed gauntlet no texture bug

v1.4
- Improved female ancient barbarian armor to reduce clipping

v1.3
- Fixes Inventory mesh to proper 3D model instead of Glass Armor
- Fixes some clipping issues
- Minor texture changes between Ranger Hood and Ancient Barbarian Hood

v1.2
- Ancient Barbarian Armor and Barbarian Armor can now only be crafted in Skyforge (does not require any smithing perks)
- Fixes some mesh clipping for female Ancient Barbarian Armor

v1.1
- removed smithing perk requirement for barbarian armor
- reduced smithing perk requirement for ancient barbarian armor from \"Glass Smithing\" to \"Advanced Smithing\"
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
HOW TO GET THESE ARMORS
(note that you can now be able to find these armors occationaly worn by bandits or other mobs throughout the land.
You can get these armors by either crafting or spawning with console..
If you want to spawn from console, type:
help \"armor name\" 4
It will show you the item ID (I think the form ID is different for each person depending on the number of mods that you have)
after that type:
player.additem XXXXXXXX 1

List of currently included armors:

Ranger Armor - Requires Advanced Smithing Perk
(Can be crafted under \"Leather\")
-Ranger Boots
-Ranger Armor
-Ranger Bracers
-Ranger Helmet

Barbarian Armor - Does NOT Require any Perks
(Can be crafted under \"Iron\")
-Barbarian Boots
-Barbarian Cuirass
-Barbarian Gauntlets
-Barbarian Helmet

Ancient Nord Barbarian Armor - REQUIRES COMPLETION OF COMPANION QUESTS
(Can only be crafted in Skyforge under \"Daedric\")
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Shoes
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Gloves
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Cuirass
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Hood

Ancient Nord Barbarian Heavy Armor - REQUIRES COMPLETION OF COMPANION QUESTS
(Can only be crafted in Skyforge under \"Daedric\")
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Boots
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Gauntlets
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Plate
- Ancient Nord Barbarian Helmet

Dwarven Mage Armor - Requires Advanced Smithing Perk
(Can be crafted under \"Dwarven\")
- Dwarven Mage Helmet
- Dwarven Mage Gauntlets
- Dwarven Mage Armor
- Dwarven Mage Boots

Heroic Imperial Armor - Requires Dwarven Smithing Perk
(Can be crafted under \"Imperial\"
- Heroic Imperial Gauntlets
- Heroic Imperial Armor
- Heroic Imperial Boots
- Heroic Imperial Helmet

Mercenary Armor - Requires Glass Smithing Perk
(I set it to require glass smithing because i dont want the armor to be obtainable easily, since it as high armor rating)
(Can be crafted under \"Iron\")
- Mercenary Boots
- Mercenary Armor
- Mercenary Gauntlets


If you think that the materials required for crafting some armor parts are too easy/difficult to craft please comment or PM me.
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Currently, these are mostly Light armor sets because I find that most
light armor in this game are just too ugly or maybe just not my taste.
I will add more sets tho including heavy armor sets in the future, just stay tuned and dont
forget to endorse my mod!
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
-INSTALLATION-
- Extract folder \"Data\" into your Skyrim root directory,
which is the folder where your TESV.exe is located.

- Run Skyrim launcher and make sure the LoreFriendlyArmors.esp is activated.

- You can obtain the armors from either crafting or typing it in console
(Sorry, but the form ID isnt working, I\'ll need to fix this hold on)

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

CREDITS:

Lateraliss - Thank you for teaching me how to add my own set of armors into skyrim
